ams

Class CardConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ams.CardConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CardConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    implements Runnable in order to allow Threads to be used Based on this tutorial ( https://www.callicoder.com/java-multithreading-thread-and-runnable-tutorial/ )

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String cardUID()
      For instances where we call the card UID from another class
      void disableSound(boolean set)
      This method disables the buzzer sound of the USB NCF Reader based on a boolean A neat option I found while researching the card reader ( API-ACR122U-2.02.pdf Page 28 - 6.7- Set Buzzer output) Some issues with this method is that I couldn't figure out how to enable it to work with the method enablePlugnPlay() as it wasn't a priority.
      boolean enablePlugnPlay()
      Enables the USB NFC reader to be removed and then reinserted without errors.
      boolean initateTerminal()
      Initiates the card terminal connection, i.e.
      void pause()
      Will pause the CardConnection
      void resume()
      Will resume the CardConnection.
      void run()
      This method is the main loop for the CardConnection, it'll continously check for new cards.

        public static java.lang.String cardUID

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardConnection

        public CardConnection()

    • Method Detail

      • enablePlugnPlay

        public boolean enablePlugnPlay()
        Enables the USB NFC reader to be removed and then reinserted without errors. Based entirely on: http://stackoverflow.com/a/16987873
        Returns:
        boolean of whether it's a success or not.

      • initateTerminal

        public boolean initateTerminal()
        Initiates the card terminal connection, i.e. connects to the USB NFC Reader.
        Returns:
        boolean of whether it's a success or not.

      • disableSound

        public void disableSound(boolean set)
        This method disables the buzzer sound of the USB NCF Reader based on a boolean A neat option I found while researching the card reader ( API-ACR122U-2.02.pdf Page 28 - 6.7- Set Buzzer output) Some issues with this method is that I couldn't figure out how to enable it to work with the method enablePlugnPlay() as it wasn't a priority.
        Parameters:
        set - boolean on whether it's set as disabled or not

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is the main loop for the CardConnection, it'll continously check for new cards. This will be used as something like: text: new Thread(CardConnection).start();
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • cardUID

        public static java.lang.String cardUID()
        For instances where we call the card UID from another class
        Returns:
        Returns the card's UID in String format.

      • pause

        public void pause()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Will pause the CardConnection
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - InterruptException

      • resume

        public void resume()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Will resume the CardConnection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - InterruptedException
